h3. Problem Definition
When scrolling down a ticket with lots of comments in the customer portal, the right sidebar which contains different actions stays on top, therefore, if a user who has scrolled all the way to the bottom wants to trigger an action he/she needs to go back to the top. However doing that makes user lose the context.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the right side bar "follow" as user scrolls down a page so that it will be always visible.

  {panel}

Currently in JIRA Service Desk, the SLA tracker will add a background color.
According to the documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/setting-up-slas-732528967.html

It will add a grey color when the SLA has less than 1 hour remaining. Yellow SLA has less than 30 minutes remaining and red when the SLA has breached the target.

As a Service Desk administrator, I would like to have the ability to change when these background colors will be used, so the Service Desk team can have a better view according to the priority of the requests, for example, set Yellow color when 60 minutes is remaining instead of 30.
fields.summary: Customise SLA Colors

 * Score (from 1 to 5 stars)

 * Multiple line comment box

 

The project administrator shall be able to create reports that include the score and single choice replies. EazyBI shall import these values.

 

Thanks,

Jon

{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 30th October 2017}
{panel}
Hello all,

Thanks for all your comments. We would love to hear from you on what you’d expect from this feature improvement. Understanding this helps us craft the right thing, that fits your needs.

If you would like to help out, please take 2 minutes to answer these questions - [https://jsd-explorations.typeform.com/to/XlzAoY]

Cheers,

— JIRA Service Desk Team

 
----
h3. Problem Definition

The current jql variables allow searching approvals and approvers as described in [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-functions-reference-764478342.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-approvedapproved()] document.
JIRA however does not store the values of which users that have approved or declined a request.
The {{pending}} and {{pendingBy("")}} option only allows for issues to be displayed that still require approval, or still require approval by a defined set of users, though it is not possible to display the users themself as a function of the issues.
Doing so would allow for reporting on this field to be put in place, as well as extend the possibilities within the issue navigator to see the actual approval status of a request
h3. Suggested Solution

Store approvers, decliners and pending approvers in a searchable field.
fields.summary: Provide a field displaying users that have approved, declined or still a pending action for a request requiring approval

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4531].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The current implementation of approvals either requires all of the approvers to provide their approval, or a fixed number out of a set of users.
In certain organisations, approval responsibility does not reside with individuals, but with groups (read, departments within the organisation).
A requirement in such an organisation could be, that in order for an approval to go through, multiple groups are required to provide their approval.
From within those groups, there are separate sets of users that can provide approval, though each group only requires to provide an "x" amount of approvals.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add an additional option in the current approval feature.
The "Get approvers from" option should not only work off a multi user picker custom field, but also a multi group picker custom field.
The "Consider approved after" option should allow for a configuration where a number of approvers per group can be set, next to the "all" option as currently available.
h3. Why this is important
Change management can rely on multiple departments within an organisation prior to changes being allowed to get pushed through.
The current implementation of the approval feature does not allow for a differentiation of user groups, reflecting these different departments within the organisation. 
h3. Workaround 
Instead of having multiple groups required to approve a request in a single step, it is possible to make several statuses and approvals per status moving the approval process from one department to another.
This is a very linear approach, and could prove to cause (several) bottlenecks to occur within the change process when one department is quicker to approve than another.
fields.summary: Add groups as a configurable entity for Approvals

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the Bulk operation on an issue navigator query, in the confirmation step, it is possible to disable emails (notifications) from being send on the actions that will be performed.
 Though this works for JIRA notifications, Service Desk notifications do not appear to be taken into consideration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a JIRA instance with Service Desk installed
 # Set up an outgoing mail server
 # Perform a search query in the issue navigator
 # Perform any bulk operation on the query result
 # In the confirmation step, uncheck the "Send mail for this update" box and proceed

Expected Results

The bulk operation follows through, and no notifications at all are being send out.
h3. Actual Results

The JIRA notifications are not being send out
However, Service Desk notifications *are* being send out
h3. Workaround

There is no proper workaround for this issue, though there are 2 options available:
# Shortly disable the outgoing mail server, however this might also impact any other events that require notifications from JIRA.
# Shortly disable Service Desk notifications. This is less intrusive than option 1 however could still impact notifications on other events than the bulk operation.
fields.summary: Disabling "Send mail for this update" option on Bulk operations does not prevent Service Desk notifications from being send

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4520].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When the user exports an issue from Service desk to CSV(all fields) the "Customer Request type" do not show the actual name of the request type, instead it shows a code from it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for service desk issue that contains not default request types
# Click on Export Excel CSV (all fields)

h3. Expected Results
On the exported csv, "Customer Request type" field shows the name of the request type.

h3. Actual Results
It shows a code from it. 
!Screen Shot 2016-11-21 at 12.08.55 PM.png|thumbnail!
(i) Take note that the exported value is in the form of: Project_Key/Request_Type_Key

h3. Workaround
Run this SQL query from the database:
(!) NOTE this is written in PostgreSQL syntax and may need to be modified for for your database type:
{code}
 select vp."KEY" as project_key, vpf."NAME" as Request_type_Name, vpf."KEY" AS request_type from "AO_54307E_VIEWPORT" vp join "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" vpf on vpf."VIEWPORT_ID" = vp."ID";
{code}
Then base on the KEY to find the NAME.
fields.summary: "Customer Request type" field get encoded when exported to CSV

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

This suggestion is considered a potential addition to our longer-term roadmap. We'll typically review this request in about 12 months time, at which point we’ll consider whether we need to alter its status.

For the nearest future we've decided to prioritise other areas of the Jira Service Management roadmap.

We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. You can read more about our [approach to highly voted suggestions here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/A-renewed-approach-to-highly-voted-Server-suggestions-for-Jira/ba-p/688117], and [how we prioritise what to implement here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].

To learn more about our recent investments in Jira Service Management and Data Center, please check our [public roadmap|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/data-center?product=jiraService&status=shipped] and our two dashboards containing [recently resolved issues|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=94990], and [current work and future plans|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=94991].

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Without this, I understand you currently have to manually administer all customer accounts and manually associate them with organizations.

Unfortunately this lack of feature is currently holding us back from using your product, as we get a large volume of customers contacting us on a daily basis.

h3. Suggested Solution
The ability to associate email domains (e.g. @companyname.com or @mybusiness.com) to organizations.

In the event of a user emailing in or a new account being created on the service desk, their account is automatically associated with the correct organization, based on the pre-determined email domain associations.
fields.summary: Email domain organization association

fields.description:
h3. Description of Problem

The JIRA Service Desk user interface allows for the configuration of an automation rule that is triggered when "A linked issue is transitioned"

This will not be triggered by a transition unless that transition causes the status of the issue to change. The automation rule will not be triggered for the create issue transition or any transitions that lead back into the same status.

The documentation also states that automation can be triggered when "A linked issue is transitioned"
 * [Automating Your Service Desk |https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/automating-your-service-desk-732528900.html]

h3. Expected Behavior

JIRA Service Desk UI and documentation is clear in saying that automation is only triggered when the status of the linked issue changes.
 * Proposing changing docs and UI to "A linked issue changes status" or something similar.

OR

The automation rule "A linked issue is transitioned" is triggered by all transitions, including the create transition and transitions where the status does not change.
fields.summary: Misleading terminology in JSD automation "A linked issue is transitioned"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Whenever an Agent is the reporter of a Service Desk request, the Service Desk notifications will take precedence over the JIRA notification scheme.
As a direct result, whenever the Agent in question is being mentioned on an internal comment, a notification will never get sent.
As the Agent is also capable of viewing the issue directly in the UI, it is expect that this notification is send out regardless.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SD project
# As Agent A, create a request in the project
# As Agent B, @mention Agent A in an internal comment

h3. Expected Results
A notification of Agent A being mentioned should be sent to Agent A

h3. Actual Results
No notifications are sent to the Agent A at all

h3. Note
* Agent A is not receiving if the ticket is resolved by Agent B.
fields.summary: Agent not receiving notification of mentions when another Agent is reporter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Installing Service Desk using the OBR from [JIRA Service Desk download|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions?_ga=1.76724125.921358105.1464567906] does not install {{servicedesk-automation-then-webhook-plugin-3.2.0-079.jar}} plugin. This makes the [option for Webhook in THEN for Service Desk automation rule|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-applications/jira-service-desk/jira-service-desk-webhooks] does not appear.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Core 7.2.4.
# Upload JIRA Service Desk 3.2.4 OBR file at {{Versions & licenses}} page.
# Go to {{Manage add-ons}} page and search for _then_.

h3. Expected Results
You will be able to see that the servicedesk-automation-then-webhook-plugin-3.2.0-079.jar plugin is installed.

h3. Actual Results
No result has been found.

h3. Workaround
Retrieve {{jira-servicedesk-application-3.2.4.obr\dependencies\servicedesk-automation-then-webhook-plugin-3.2.0-079.jar}} and install using the Upload Add-on option that appears on the Mange Add-ons page. 
* The .obr can be renamed .zip and opened like a zip file.

 
h3. Notes
If you extract the OBR file, you will be able to see the JAR file in the dependencies folder.
fields.summary: Installing JIRA Service Desk OBR does not install servicedesk-automation-then-webhook-plugin-3.2.0-079.jar

When users receive a JIRA notification for an SD project (internal notification, not SD notification), the issue type icon is not rendered. Only seems to be happening to SD projects
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Make sure you have agent access
 # Set your profile to *Notify me* of own changes

 # As the agent, assign the request to yourself

 # You receive an internal JIRA notification with all icons rendered properly

h3. Actual Results
 # You receive an internal JIRA notification but the Issue Type icon is *not* rendered

h3. Notes
 # Tested with Gmail
 # Tested opening the email in both Windows and Ubuntu machine
 # Affecting IE11 and Google Chrome. Also affects Outlook
 # When the email is opened in Firefox, the alternate text is displayed instead (ie. IT-Help)
 # Doesn't happen for Software/Business projects

h3. Workaround

No known workaround

  {panel}

h4. +Summary+
There're chances that an SD request is moved to a non-SD project e.g. from SD-1 to NSD-2. In this case, when accessing SD-1 via its Portal URL it says the request has been moved to a project which you have no access. This is because there's no Portal URL for NSD-2 to be redirected to.

h4. +Suggestion+
Theoretically this is a correct message. However, if NSD is open to Anonymous access, then it would be better if JIRA or SD could detect this and redirect SD-1 to the JIRA URL of NSD-2, which will be accessible by any Anonymous user.

h4. +Note+
When it comes to Anonymous, this should be tracked closely with JSD-4467.
fields.summary: Redirect a Moved Request to its JIRA URL if Portal URL is Not Available and Anonymous View is Enabled

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4488].
  {panel}

h2.Summary

Attachments that are embedded into comments, when sent as a notification to a JIRA Service Desk customer, are not accessible without login. Considering that most customers in JSD are created automatically because of public sign up, these customers don't really have the password to login to view these attachments directly. This problem is similar to {{https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1361}} and is possibly a regression.

h2.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Service Desk ticket.
# Attach an attachment to the ticket.
# Change the reporter to JIRA Service Desk customer that uses one of your emails.
# Embed said attachments in a comment via [^test.png] so that it triggers a notification to the reporter.
# When you receive the notification, copy the attachment link and load it on *private/incognito browsing'.

h2.Expected Result
Customer should be able to view the attachments without login.

h2.Current Result
Customer have to login first to view the attachments.
fields.summary: Clicking on attachments link from JSD notification requires login

  {panel}

*Suggestion*

Following the addition of the 'Organizations' feature in -JSD-270- it would be useful if we could show or hide Request Types based on what Organization the user belongs to.

*Example*

User A is set up and is added to Organization A

User B is set up and added to Organization B.

A new Request Type called Request A is set up

Permissions are added to Request A so that only Organization A can view it in the portal

This means that User A can see this Request Type when they login to the Portal, but User B cannot

*Why it would be useful*

This would be useful as we are currently dealing with multiple clients within a single Service Desk. The ability to do this would allow us to personalize a portal for each client that we have.
fields.summary: Ability to show/hide Request Types based on Organization Membership

h3. Problem Definition
Customers have concerns in the way reporters and participants might be commenting on issues (e.g. by replies to email notifications) WITHOUT being aware of all the other participants on the same issue. They might have absolutely no idea that there are 5 more participants.

h3. Suggested Solution
Split the event 'Issue Commented' into 2 specific events

h3. Summary

Currently, the 'Organization' field in Service Desk can be set as a required field and added to the 'Create' screen for an issue. The problem with this is that the 'Organization' selection only shows up in the Customer Portal and will not appear as a visible field in the Create screen, thus making it impossible for an admin to require an organization to be chosen, and create a Service Desk ticket through JIRA rather than the Portal. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Set 'Organization' as a required field

2. Add the field to the create screen in a Service Desk project
h3. Expected Results

The field should be visible and able to be set, or Service Desk should not allow you to set the field as required. 
h3. Actual Results

The field will only be visible in the Customer Portal and a user will not be able to create a ticket in that project through JIRA.
h3. Notes 

This might be intended functionality (as Organization is primarily a contact field and is meant as an option for customers to share a ticket with their org.), but allowing it to be set as required and put into a 'Create' screen causes confusion, as the ability implies that this field can be set through JIRA during issue creation.

h3. Summary
When trying get the latest forwarded message in an incoming email and add it as a comment. A workaround that by removing "----- Forwarded message -----" and "From:" from the email and it led to a very random behaviour where sometimes email stripping works correctly, sometimes it strips everything but the first line and the email channel address.

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+
By rights, free SD customers have no access to JIRA tickets which are not available on SD Customer Portal. In order to allow customers to view those tickets, the JIRA project must be open to Anyone i.e. [allowing anonymous access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Allowing+anonymous+access+to+your+project].

When this happens, customers may receive email notifications from the tickets. If they click the email links to view the tickets when logged in, however, they won't be able to view the tickets but will be redirected to Customer Portal instead (without knowing why). They will have to log out to view the tickets or open them in a different browser for anonymous access.

h4. +Background+
This is indeed an expected behavior, as group Anyone is actually meant for anonymous access. It doesn't literally mean that anyone, regardless of logged-in or anonymous, can browse and view the tickets. What actually happens is:
* If there's no user session (or anonymous), JIRA won't check user permissions but simply open the tickets for anonymous view
* If there's a user session (user logged-in), JIRA will check user permissions and deny access from SD customers since they don't have application access to JIRA

h4. +Suggestion+
This could be a bug or a suggestion, but there should be a better way to handle this situation to avoid bringing the customers the wrong impression that _they can't view the tickets_ or _they have to log out to view a ticket_. Some possible solutions are:
# Replace Group (Anyone) with Anonymous Access in the JIRA schemes. This at least helps JIRA admins to beware that the permission is granted to anonymous users only, not logged-in users.
# Don't redirect customers to Portal without telling them why. It's better to keep them in the same link and display a message telling them that they don't have the permission to view it, however they can view it anonymously if they log out.
# Allow customers to view open tickets even when they're logged in, but still restrict them from accessing other functionalities.
fields.summary: Customers get confused when they have to log out to view JIRA tickets that are open to Anyone

This seems to be a regression of JSD-2419 / JRA-59259. The fix was planned for JIRA 7.2.0 / SD 3.2.0 however the new sidebar in SD 3.2.x seems to be failing the fix.

h4. +Step to reproduce+

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4464].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

I would like to be able to embed our knowledge base in our customer portal so it can all be on one page, rather than a link from the portal to a separate page.

The primary goal is more visibility on what the common questions and issues are, so people can easily find the answer they are looking for *at a glance*.

Requiring customers to start typing a search doesn't resolve the issue of visibility because non-technical people are often hesitant to do it and articles won't show unless the user types in the appropriate words/phrases. IF a user does't know how to properly describe the issue but would recognize it in a list of articles, they may end up getting frustrated and create an unnecessary ticket, or leave the site entirely.
h3. Suggested Solution

To avoid having a bad user experience, I want to make the Confluence Space more readily available, such that how-to pages and FAQs are clearly listed in our Customer Portal.

Thus, I'd like to be able to embed our Confluence Space in the Customer Portal.
h3. Workaround

Educate users to visit Confluence first, and [configure a banner associated with the Knowledge Base space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-add-a-space-wide-banner-717062877.html] referring users to the Customer Portal if they can't find the answer to their question.
fields.summary: As an administrator I want to be able to embed my knowledge base into the customer portal

h3. Description of problem:

JIRA Service Desk 3.2.4 was released and is available to download when bundled with JIRA Core.
 * [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk/download]

JIRA Service Desk 3.2.4 is not available on the marketplace.atlassian.com version history
 * [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions]

h3. Impact:
 # JIRA UPM will not suggest an upgrade unless the version is present in MPAC.
 ** UPM currently suggests an upgrade to JIRA Core 7.2.4 but does not suggest that the JIRA Software application be updated to 7.2.4
 # Users will not be able to download the application files as an .obr.

h3. Expected results:

MPAC version history contains all versions of JIRA Service Desk 3.0+.
h3. Workaround:
 # [Download the JIRA Service Desk installer|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk/download] and select the Linux version (32 or 64 bit)
 # Unzip the bin file using a tool such as 7zip
 # Copy the contents of the following folder into your JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins folder
 ** {{atlassian-servicedesk-3.2.4-x##.bin\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\application-installation\jira-servicedesk-application}}
 ** When doing this you may remove the older version of the same plugins that you copy over.
 # Restart JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk 3.2.4 missing from MPAC version history

  {panel}

JSD calendars are useful for enforcing non-24hr hours of operation.  However, they fail to take account of when an organisation operates in a location with daylight saving time. 

For instance a contract may specify 9am - 6pm for support. However the server time does not change to reflect daylight saving time. Therefore for part of the year the SLA calendar will not align with the contract hours.

I discussed this at Summit 2016 with Vidhu, Lingbo and Adriana.  Please contact me direct for a PoC. 

A partial workaround is to use the created time to determine which SLA calendar to use and define summer and winter calendars. I am about to publish a blog post on this workaround and will add a comment when I have the url.
fields.summary: Handle Daylight Saving Time in JSD Calendars

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a New install of JIRA Software with Service Desk the *[Show transition in the customer portal | https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver032/configuring-the-customer-portal-828800627.html#Configuringthecustomerportal-addTransitionsAddtransitions]* check box is not available in edit mode

h3. Environment
- Only Found to occur on New Install of JIRA 7.2.3 in combination with Service Desk 3.2.3
- Upgrading to the effected combo from a previous version using the upgrade wizard does not experience the issue


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.2.3
# Install Service Desk 3.2.3
# Create Service desk project 
# Edit the workflow
# Select a transition in diagram mode

h3. Expected Results
[As detailed here | https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver032/configuring-the-customer-portal-828800627.html#Configuringthecustomerportal-addTransitionsAddtransitions] the *Show transition in the customer portal* option will be visible as an option:
!Screen Shot 2016-10-27 at 5.15.13 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Option is missing
!Screen Shot 2016-10-27 at 4.56.17 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
* Shut down JIRA
* Delete the following hidden plugin cache directories:
{code}
JIRA_HOME/plugins/.bundled-plugins
JIRA_HOME/plugins/.osgi-plugins
{code}
* Restart JIRA (These directories will be recreated on JIRA reboot with new plugin cache)
fields.summary: Show transition in the customer portal checkbox is missing in new install

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4444].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When moving a ticket from a workflow that requires approval to another that does not, the approval need will not be removed, even though the target workflow does not use it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Modify the workflow from an issue type on a Service Desk Project to require approval, and have at least one issue type on the same project that does not have approval as part of the workflow.
# Create a ticket on the issue type that needs approval
# Move the ticket to the issue type that does not require approval

h3. Expected Results

The approval need is removed.

h3. Actual Results

The ticket will still need to be approved.

h3.Workaround

Both the approver and approval can be removed directly on the database:

# Backup JIRA using our [XML Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/backing-up-data-802592964.html#Backingupdata-xml_backupUsingJIRA%27sXMLbackuputility] utility or your native database tools.
# Delete the approver: {code:sql}delete from "AO_56464C_APPROVER" where "APPROVAL_ID" = (select "ID" from "AO_56464C_APPROVAL" where "ISSUE_ID" = (select id from jiraissue where issuenum = 'issue_number' and project = (select id from project where pkey = 'project_key')));{code}
# Delete the approval: {code:sql}delete from "AO_56464C_APPROVAL" where "ISSUE_ID" = (select id from jiraissue where issuenum = 'issue_number' and project = (select id from project where pkey = 'project_key'));{code}
fields.summary: Moving a ticket won't remove approval need

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Due to JRA-47056, some email replies which are sent from a Zimbra client could fail to be added as a comment. In these cases, the error message in the Processing Logs is incorrect.

It shows _Message body is empty where Description field is required_ although Description is *not* required. The fact that Description is *not* required is also confirmed by using gmail to send an empty body email which still successfully gets added as a comment or creates a new ticket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure SD to make sure the Description is *not* required
# Use a Zimbra client to create a request via email
# As an agent, reply in the request which would send a notification to the customer
# As the customer, reply this email *with contents*
# Check the _Processing Logs_

h3. Expected Results
# Original expected results is that the email will be added as a comment
# However, due to JRA-47056, the email will not add any comment
# This being said, the _Processing logs_ should show a proper error or no errors at all

h3. Actual Results
# The _Processing logs_ show the following incorrect error
{code}Message body is empty where Description field is required{code}
#* This error is misleading

h3. Notes
* Seems that not all Zimbra clients are affected by this

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Incorrect error in Processing Logs when using Zimbra Client

+Suggestion Summary+

Currently in Service Desk, when an agent attempts to invite a user as a participant and the email does not exist yet, the user cannot be selected or invited.

+How to Verify+

# Go to {{Project > SD Project > Issue}} as an agent.
# Type in an email of a user that is not a customer in the request participant field.

+Expected Result+

JIRA should trigger an invite to the user to join Service Desk and also alert him he has been invited as a participant.

+Actual Result+

JIRA would let the agent know that the user does not exist hence he cannot be added to the field.
fields.summary: Allow Agents to Request Participants via Email that do not belong to customer

The Service Desk Reporting creates tables with names that exceed the Oracle naming limit of 30 bytes, resulting in ORA-00972:
* http://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28286/sql_elements008.htm#sthref727

Example name:
* AO_0201F0_KB_HELPFUL_ARTICLE_AGGR

This will fail for any customers running Oracle db.

We would like to be able to add screenshots directly inline from the description field in the Customer Portal.  You can now do this from within JIRA itself which is nice and you can now paste screenshots in the portal (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-725) which is also nice but the use case we have is for customers who are trying to describe something using screenshots.  

For instance, customer comes to the Service Desk portal and starts creating a ticket.  In the description they want to say:
I can't log in.  Here is a screenshot of the login screen:
(screenshot of login screen)
When I supply my username and password I get this error:
(screenshot of the error screen)

Today you cannot do this from the Customer Portal.  You can attach images but you cannot easily relate those images to the text in the description.
fields.summary: Attachments/Screenshots in the description from the Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, from the documentation [Serving customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER032/Serving+customers+with+a+knowledge+base] to get the Knowledge Based working "A JIRA administrator can link the applications with an application link that uses OAuth." But, the integration with OAuth it does not work anymore on the latest JIRA Service Desk version where "Execute As" is not available anymore.

The integration would need either:
- Application Link integration with OAuth(Impersonation)
- If using OAuth only, the Confluence Space would need to open for Anonymous Access.

h3. Suggested Solution:
Updating the Documentation for the latest version with the changes and requirement to link JIRA Service Desk with Confluence Space.
fields.summary: Documentation Update for Knowledge Base integration

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If you use a URL custom field and make it visible on the Customer Portal it will display as text instead of as a clickable link.

When viewed in JIRA as an agent, however, the link is rendered as clickable. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Update renderer for URL Custom Fields such that the links are clickable in Portal View.

h3. Workaround 
Instead of using a URL custom field type, you could use a Text (Single Line) custom field with the Renderer set to *Wiki Style Renderer*.  This will correctly render URLs as clickable, however it won't perform input validation to ensure you are entering a URL.
fields.summary: Render URL Custom Fields as Links in Customer Portal

My customers create issues via the portal and email. There are scenarios where the customer wants to change the priority. Today they can only request this by submitting a comment and hoping that the agent acts on it. We have rules/automation that result in escalation notification if priority is set to Urgent/Highest. If the agent doesn't act on, or does so in a delayed manner, then the notification does not occur or is delayed.

There may be a workaround here though ugly (I need to test this). Transitions could be created in the workflow for each priority level setting the transition from "All". Then expose each of these transitions on the portal. The customer could then click on the transitions, e.g.
* Priority = Highest
* Priority = High
* Priority = Medium
* Priority = Low
* Priority = Lowest

again...yuck!
fields.summary: Allow customers to edit the priority of an existing issue

Hi,

We're using service desk to monitor SLA's but primarily use Kanban boards to manage our work.

We can add SLA fields to the Issue Cards but we:
 # want to use those 3 fields for other detail
 # feel it looks pretty untidy
 # can't necessairily fit all the SLA's into the space on the cards

What we would like is to be able to add these fields to the issue detail screen in the same was we can add most other fields. This seems a sensible addition to the 7.x roadmap as it further integrates the JIRA product suite.
fields.summary: Allow SLA timer fields to be added to the issue detail screen in Scrum and Kanban boards

  {panel}

It would be awesome if SLA reports let select additional conditions 'on the fly' for filtering and presenting data, in a very similar manner than the 'Past 7 days' option does.

As a Service Desk Agent, I'd like to be able to select among those fields that are frequently used in SLA's JQL queries and re-draw the graph accordingly:
* Organization (great new feature!)
* Priority
* Customer Request Type

This feature would allow drawing many different graphs from a single SLA report definition, instead of having to define one for every desired combination, ie:

If we served 10 organizations with 4 customer request types and 5 priority levels, we would need to define 200 SLA reports for having insight on their combinations.

Wouldn't it be great to have just one instead?
fields.summary: Dynamic SLA reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4419].
  {panel}

As a Service Desk admin, I want to be notified (or better yet, allow me to designate who should be notified) when the account for a user who is auto-assigned to one or more issues becomes disabled.

Scenario, an employee leaves the company and their account is disabled in Active Directory (AD).  Since JIRA is connected to AD, the JIRA account will become disabled automatically.  If this user is auto-assigned on any Service Desk request forms, submission of those forms will break with the user becomes disabled.

Ideally, there would be a backup user that the system would fall back to if a primary account were to be disabled, but at the very least, I need to select a user to notify when this situation occurs.

This is critical to keeping the service desk functioning because I have no visibility into when accounts become disabled.
fields.summary: Notify admin when Service Desk assignee account is disabled

I am finding it difficult to manage the customer organisations in JSD. Customers email through and get added to the customer list but we have to manually add them to an organisation. It would be ideal to have a rule in the organisation that can be turned off or on that includes a domain extension. If a customer emails through with the specified domain extension they are auto added to the organisation.

AC:
- Set a domain extension on the Organization
- System reviews the emails sent through for a new customer and if the domain extension is matched to an organisation it adds the customer to that organisation
fields.summary: Add email domain to Customer Organisation
